info.title: Gett to Fleet API v1.2
info.description: Fleet Server API. Compulsory to be used by any new integrating partner. The API needs to be implemented by fleet server in order to receive ASAP from Gett. This version contains changes to the addresses and passenger data objects to support complex routes with multiple pickup and drop-off locations.

post.description:
Used for Gett to query availability of the service, estimated time for driver arrival and estimated price (if Gett and supplier agree that supplier provides price).
As this request is very sensitive to present information to users, Gett expects supplier to respond within 5 seconds. High performance of this request is crucial.
Quote object inside quotes array represents parameters of a particular supplier. Each request is being sent for a specific service type. Supplier should return 1 quote if they own the service. Supplier may return 1 or more quotes if it aggregates multiple sub-fleets underneath (acts as a marketplace of suppliers).

Async flow is being considered as redundant, as it's not required to provide a response within 5 seconds! For integrations that already implemented it, it will remain supported.
This request is polling until returned status is FINISHED or 15 sec timeout is exceeded. The ID field in the request will contain ID returned in first response by partner. This is for continuous polling of quotes for same request every 3 seconds.

address.full_address: Apartment 2904, Talisman Tower, 6 Lincoln Plaza, London E14 9BP
Bank of England, Threadneedle St, London EC2R 8AH, UK
Heathrow Terminal 4, Heathrow Airport, Heathrow Airport (LHR), Terminal 4, Nelson Rd, Hounslow TW6 3XA, UK

200.description: Quotes Response – a list of available options; can be either empty, one or many.

post.description: This endpoint will be called when Gett passes new ASAP order to the fleet. This request should return 201 in case order created successfully. 400 if request with given parameters cannot be satisfied. There is a chance this request will be sent several times with same order ID. In this case the fleet server is required to return 201. This can happen if there is a network disconnect and Gett server performs retry. If 500 returned, Gett server will perform retry.

Heathrow Terminal 4, Heathrow Airport, Heathrow Airport, Terminal 4, Nelson Rd, Hounslow TW6 3XA, UK

post.description: This endpoint will be called when Gett passes new future order to the fleet. This request should return 201 in case order created successfully. 400 if request with given parameters cannot be satisfied. There is a chance this request will be sent several times with same order ID. In this case the fleet server is required to return 201. This can happen if there is a network disconnect and Gett server performs retry. If 500 returned, Gett server will perform retry.

Heathrow Terminal 4, Heathrow Airport, Heathrow Airport, Terminal 4, Nelson Rd, Hounslow TW6 3XA, UK

put.description: This endpoint will be called when Gett order is being updated - for example rider changes the destination. This request should return 201 in case order created successfully. 400 if request with given parameters cannot be satisfied. There is a chance this request will be sent several times with same order ID. In this case the fleet server is required to return 201. This can happen if there is a network disconnect and Gett server performs retry. If 500 returned, Gett server will perform retry.

delete.description: This endpoint will be called when Gett order is canceled. Upon agreement, cancellation fee can be calculated by Gett or partner. This request should return 204 in case order canceled successfully and fee is calculated by Gett. 200 response should be returned along with cancellation fee. 400 if request with given parameters cannot be satisfied. There is a chance this request will be sent several times with same order ID. In this case the fleet server is required to return 201. This can happen if there is a network disconnect and Gett server performs retry. If 500 returned, Gett server will perform retry.

200.description: Return with cancellation in the body

get.description:
Photo of driver.
This endpoint will be called if driver has_picure attribute set to true when fleet calls /accept API. This API will be called once for each driver ID.
Recommended parameters are JPEG square photo with 1000px resolution.

parameters.name: driver_id
parameters.description: same driver_id submitted on Accept Order

post.description: This API to be called to request information about drivers near a client to show them on the map in the client app. This endpoint will be polled every 5 seconds until the moment client places a booking.

requestBody.description: Info about client location and service types presented.

200.description: Return list of drivers and their recent locations.

post.description: This API gets called when client presses "I'll be there" button in Gett client app after driver arrival. To be used to notify driver that rider is aware of driver arrival to pickup and they will be around soon
For B2C rides only, optional. This API will be called shortly after Complete status submission to provide amount of tips that rider decided to give the driver for the order.

API is used to regularly check order statuses between Gett and a partner to avoid any desync happening during an order lifetime. Sync is called about every minute and stops when order is Completed, Cancelled or Un-reserved, Rejected by a Supplier.

common_types.Address.title: address
common_types.Address.description: Breakdown of the address. Provided either by Google or PostCodeAnywhere (UK-only). Address is provided in the local language of the order request country.

full_address.description: Human readable full address of the location

poi.description: flag whether address is Point of interest

IATA.description: If address is airport, the IATA code of the airport will be provided. Regardless of the flight info presence.

quote_id.description: Optional. Provided only if Fleet previously responded to Request Quotes. request.

scheduled_at.description: The timestamp of arrival to pickup

rider_vip.description: VIP status information for the rider

is_vip.description: Requires coordination with Gett. Can be sent to flag whether a passenger is agreed to be treated as VIP. If true, then VIP.

service_type.description: Level and type of service requested by client. One or many. Upon agreement with supplier.

price.description: Amount in major units like pounds, rubles, shekels of dollars. For example, two pounds and thirty five penny is 2.35.

currency.description: ISO 4217 code of the currency: GBP, ILS, USD, EUR.

quote_id.description: Optional. Provided only if Fleet previously responded to Request Quotes. request.

rider_vip.description: VIP status information for the rider

is_vip.description: Requires coordination with Gett. Can be sent to flag whether a passenger is agreed to be treated as VIP. If true, then VIP.

service_type.description: Level and type of service requested by client. Upon agreement with supplier.

price.description: Amount in major units like pounds, rubles, shekels of dollars. For example 1, 2.35.

models.StopPoint.title: StopPoint
models.StopPoint.description: Information about all stops on the order, including both pick up and drop off locations.

id.description: Stop point identifier for subsequent use in Fleet Client API

planned_arrival_at.description: Expected time for a driver to arrive at the stop. Matches scheduled_at for the origin.

riders.description: Info about all passengers to be picked up or dropped off at the stop

models.QuoteStopPoint.title: StopPoint
models.QuoteStopPoint.description: Information about all stops on the order, including both pick up and drop off locations.

models.ArrivingFlight.title: Arriving Flight Information

airport_code.description: Example: "LHR" for London Heathrow. "JFK" for John F. Kennedy International Airport.

flight_offset.description: The delay in minutes between the actual landing time of a flight and scheduled_at_time

models.ArrivingFlight.description: Optional. Information in IATA format about passenger's flight.

models.Preferences.title: Custom Preferences for a ride or a passenger/company account.

tolls_allowed.description: Applicable to RU only. Defines if a company/passenger would like a driver to go via toll road (if possible). If true, it is expected that driver also pays for the toll road. The price is being compensated to a supplier by Gett during regular Billing cycle. Null means that feature is undefined for the current region.

models.Preferences.description: Optional. Custom preferences for an order. Being defined by a client or Gett platform.

id.description: Quotes request ID. Will be empty on first request. Subsequent requests will contain ID returned in first response as "id" by partner. This is done for continuous async polling of quotes

scheduled_at.description: The timestamp of arrival to pickup. Null for ASAP requests (for now)

service_type.description: Level and type of service requested by client. Upon agreement with supplier.

retrieving_state.description:
IN_PROGRESS – quotes production is still in progress
FINISHED – all available quotes are produced

service_types.description: Matches the Service types from Quotes or Order requests. The request list will be limited to only 1 option at a time.

models.Quote_min_price.description: Min price of range. Can be equal to max if range not applicable

models.Quote_max_price.description: Max price of range. Can be equal to min if range not applicable

models.currency_symbol.description: Currency symbol for the price returned in quote. £, ₪, $, €

models.currency_code.description: Currency code for the price in quote in ISO 4217 format.

models.NearbyDriversResponse_nearby_driv.description: Structure of drivers per service type

timestamp.description: Timestamp of location to proximate driver speed and location relevance.

reason.description: Automatically generated reason of the cancellation request.

verbose.description: A flag specfying whether Gett expects in Response only status to be returned or also additional details. True is returned only if Gett understands order is Completed or Cancelled.

apiv1ride_exchangeordersync_orders.description: Structure of properties, each being formed of order_id of specific order that Gett is trying to synchronize. Each order_id structure is empty in the request.

supplier_status.description:
Required.Status of the ride.
One of 'Confirmed','Waiting','Driving','Completed'.
'Confirmed' - when driver accepted the ride and on the way to pickup.
'Waiting' - when driver arrive to pickup and Waiting for the rider.
'Driving' - when driver picked up the rider and on the way to destination.
'Completed' - when arrived to destination and the ride is finished, in this case there are mandatory fields in this call: 'destination','arrived_at', 'started_at', 'ended_at','total_distance_meters'

rate.description: When it is agreed with a supplier to provide tip as a percentage of total final price. Gett shares a percentage upfront and expect a supplier to calculate final value and the end of the ride. Calculated tip amount is expected to be passed to a driver.

amount.description: When it is agreed with a supplier to provide tip as an absolute amount, for example $20. It is expected that a supplier adds the amount to the final price, and passes tip to a driver.

models.Preferences_tip.description: For the US only. Provides either an amount or percentage of tip that a client would like to leave for a ride. Usually, it is a pre-defined preference.

company_code.description: Used to let a supplier recognize a particular company or company type requesting a ride. Values should be pre-agreed between Gett and a partner.

ApiKeyAuth.description:
Authentication requires a static Bearer token provided by Gett before integration launch.
This token must be included in the `Authorization` header on every request.
The token itself does not expire but can be rotated upon request.

**Format:**
`Authorization: Bearer {your-static-gett-token}`

Please contact Gett support if you need your token or require a rotation.
